p: In 1993–1994, CeMV caused another outbreak of mortality, this time in a population of T. truncatus from the Gulf of Mexico, spanning from Florida (Panama City) to Texas [ 92, 150]. A total of 171 specimens were retrieved from the entire Texas coast in March and April 1994 [ 151]. About a quarter of 34 dolphins sampled in Matagorda Bay in 1992 had CeMV antibodies, indicating that this community/population had been exposed to the virus before the 1993–1994 outbreak occurred [ 25].
